alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Hampshire; Hardy; Jefferson; Morgan (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 12 at 3:19AM EST until March 12 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. Northwest winds will gust around 45 to 55 mph. * WHERE...Washington County in Maryland, the eastern West Virginia Panhandle, the Potomac Highlands of West Virginia, and the northern Shenandoah Valley of Virginia. * WHEN...Until 3 PM this afternoon. Rain will change to snow between 5 AM and 7 AM this morning. A band of moderate to heavy snow is most likely through mid-morning before tapering off to a lighter snow late this morning into early this afternoon. Scattered snow showers are possible later this afternoon and evening as well. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Visibility may be reduced to below one- quarter mile at times. Brief near blizzard conditions are possible. Snowfall rates around one to two inches per hour are expected this morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
